application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: T7 / 947	Copper Beech (Fagus sylvatica purpurea)	Fell to ground level and remove all arisings - cavity forming on west side of stem at ground level, Kretzschmaria deusta fruiting bodies noted in face of cavity. 	T8 / 948	Western Red Cedar (Thuja plicata)	Grosvenor court to arrange with Gale - Detailed decay evaluation of lower stem employing the use of a Resi PD400 microdrill - Vertical open wound on SE side of stem from ground level up to c.5m, wood dust noted caught in spiders webs along the length of the wound. Crown becoming sparse, needle debris on the floor - parakeets seen in upper crown. T11 / 951	False Acacia (Robinia pseudoacacia)	Grosvenor court to arrange with Gale - Perform a detailed decay evaluation of the stem at c.7m employing the use of a Resi PD400 microdrill. Desiccated fungal fruiting body at c.7m on N side of stem next to a pruning stub with a woodpecker hole. Dead truncated tertiary stem section at c.11m over border/public pavement. Non-invasive cable bracing installed in upper crown due to extensive tear out wound.
